q: gets the job title of co-founder and will work on strategic projects and products. "For the last 10 years, we have all been equally involved in making decisions," Eric Schmidt wrote. This triumvirate approach has real benefits in terms of shared wisdom, and we will continue to discuss the big decisions among the three of us. But we have also agreed to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company, Eric Schmidt wrote. The change over indicates there's been a clear decision to put a technologist back in charge and to return some of the founding drive to strategic and day-to-day decisions, given Page's role

She also wished her ex and his fiancee, Kayte Walsh , love and happiness in their new marriage. Those are the kinds of good wishes that only a dollar sign followed by a lot of zeroes buys. Kelsey told David Letterman last month that he plans to marry Kayte Walsh this month.

Eric Schmidt seems to agree, writing in a blog post that Page is "ready to lead," and that while the past decade has been a remarkable one for Google, the next 10 years under Larry will be even better. For that prediction to come true, Page will have to dream up a new venture as big and as profitable as Google's legacy search advertising business.
